note_text:
**Patient:** Maria Garcia
**Age:** 28
**Gender:** F
**Occupation:** registered nurse

**Chief Complaint:**  
Back pain, severe, 2 weeks.

**HPI:**  
Pt c/o severe LBP, sharp w/ movement, dull at rest. Onset after lifting at work. Pain radiates to L leg, no numbness/tingling. Ibuprofen helps.

**ROS:**  
Musculoskeletal: LBP, radiculopathy. Neuro: No weakness/numbness. Constitutional/GU: No fever, normal bowel/bladder.

**Physical Exam:**  
VS: BP 128/82, HR 74, Temp 98.4, RR 14.  
Back: Tender L3-L5, muscle spasm. Neuro: +SLR L, motor/sensory WNL, reflexes 2+. Gait antalgic.

**Assessment/Plan:**  
Acute mech LBP, lumbar strain w/ L radiculopathy. Continue ibuprofen, add cyclobenzaprine HS. Avoid heavy lifting, PT referral. Heat/ice therapy. RTC PRN.
